list_definition.definition: a statement or description of what has been said, seen, done etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: a police report on the accident.
According to report, the manager is going to resign.

list_definition.definition: a loud noise, especially of a gun being fired.
to give a statement or description of what has been said, seen, done etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: A serious accident has just been reported
He reported on the results of the conference
Our spies report that troops are being moved to the border
His speech was reported in the newspaper.

list_definition.definition: to make a complaint about; to give information about the misbehaviour/misbehavior etc of

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The boy was reported to the headmaster for being rude to a teacher.

list_definition.definition: to tell someone in authority about

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: He reported the theft to the police.

list_definition.definition: to go (to a place or a person) and announce that one is there, ready for work etc

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The boys were ordered to report to the police station every Saturday afternoon
Report to me when you return
How many policemen reported for duty?
